.
Sending Corrected Notice of Proposed Adverse Action
When a claimant is provided insufficient notice of proposed adverse action, provide corrected notice and restart the due process period.Â  Inaccuracies in the prior notice that will cause it to be considered insufficient include
failure to provide
proposed rates of payment
a date of reduction
detailed reasons for the proposed decision, or
notice of the right to
present evidence
request a personal hearing, and/or
have representation, and
providing
a proposed rate of payment that is incorrect
and
greater than what it should have been, or
a date of reduction that is incorrect
and
later than the date the reduction will actually occur.
Notes
:
When the final decision is more favorable than that communicated in the notice of proposed adverse action, proceed with the more favorable final decision without resending notice unless notice was provided under the incorrect provision as discussed in
M21-1, Part X, Subpart ii, 3.A.3.d
.
Do
not
send a corrected notice of proposed adverse action if the proposed rates of payment were correct when VA sent the notice but the final rates are different because of an intervening award action.
